description:

Material Design para mancos

Hace m√°s de un a√±o, Google nos proporcion√≥ Material Design, acabando con todas aquellas aplicaciones con dise√±os simples y combinaciones de colores horteras, y de paso abocando a millones de dise√±adores al paro. Ponente: Joan Fuentes es¬†Android developer, entusiasta de las tecnolog√≠as m√≥viles, ingeniero inform√°tico y Mobile software engineer en Redbooth.¬†


Android Evolution: The Era of Frameworks

Cuando uno se inicia en el desarrollo Android, al principio cree firmemente en el framework de Android. A medida que trabajas con √©l, te das cuenta que tiene carencias y problemas, y vas renegando lentamente de una parte. Pero descubres que hay terceros que han sacado sus propios frameworks y librer√≠as, y durante un tiempo todo vuelve a ser felicidad. Hasta que empiezas a ver las carencias de estos. Pero entonces salen nuevos. Y es que parece que estamos condenados a tropezar con la misma piedra una y otra vez.

En esta charla hablaremos de los frameworks y librer√≠as m√°s populares para Android, incidiendo en como encajan en nuestra arquitectura; que pros y contras tienen; como pueden acabar condicionando el desarrollo de nuestra aplicaci√≥n; y que trucos podemos usar para evitar algunos de los da√±os colaterales que pueden ocasionar. Pero sobretodo nos haremos la siguiente pregunta: ¬øseguro que los necesitamos?

name: Android Performance
description:
Performance is just as essential to native apps as it is to web applications, but it is only recently that developers have begun to seriously look into the performance issues in their native applications. In this presentation, Doug Sillars will do a demo of some performance tools for native applications, and discuss how we might integrate them into our workflow.

Alongside the talk there will be a dive into a couple of great tools out there that can help developers find perf issues:¬†

‚Ä¢¬†Leak Canary for memory leaks

‚Ä¢¬†ARO for network Performance¬†

If time (and interest) permits, we can also look at Systrace or other tools for CPU performance.

-----------------

Doug Sillars @dougsillars¬†is a leader in the mobile performance community, focusing on helping developers improve the speed and performance of mobile websites and applications. Doug has presented AT&T‚Äôs award winning performance tools at developer conferences around the world. A member of the AT&T Developer Program for the last 11 years, Doug is the technical lead on the performance outreach team. He is the author of O'Reilly's "High Performance Android Apps" In his spare time, Doug enjoys playing soccer with his wife and four children, shooing the muddy dogs off the sofa, and taking care of the various bunnies, chickens and furry goats that they keep on a small farm outside of Seattle.

name: IWD Women Techmakers Barcelona 2018 #iwd #wtm #iwdbcn18 #wtmbarcelona
description:
‚Ä¢ Was wir unternehmen werden
Hola Techies! Aqu√≠ estamos de nuevo con nuestra 3a edici√≥n de Women Techmakers International Women's Day! Este a√±o tenemos un mont√≥n de novedades preparadas para vosotros y vosotras y esperamos veros el pr√≥ximo 10 de Marzo en El Centro de Cultura Contempor√°nea de Barcelona.

Coincidiendo con la celebraci√≥n del d√≠a internacional de la mujer, durante los meses de Marzo y Abril, se organizan eventos en comunidades por todo el mundo. El prop√≥sito de los mismos es dar confianza y visibilidad de la mujer en este sector y mitigar el desequilibrio de g√©nero que se encuentra en el mismo. Todo p√∫blico es bienvenido, pero la particularidad es que en estos eventos las ponentes son exclusivamente mujeres. En nuestra 3a edici√≥n os vamos a ofrecer un d√≠a entero de conferencias. Desde las 9h hasta las 18:30h contaremos con 2 tracks: uno en castellano y otro en ingl√©s en los que disfrutaremos de interesantes charlas, un workshop y dos mesas redondas. Hey Techies! Here we are again with our 3rd edition of the Women Techmakers International Women‚Äôs Day! This year we have a lot of new things prepared for you and we hope to see you all next 10th of March at the Center for Contemporary Culture Barcelona.

Women Techmakers is an initiative leaded by Google with the goal to promote and give visibility to women in tech. With the occasion of the International Women‚Äôs Day, in March and April, communities from all around the world are organizing special events. Everyone is invited and more than welcome to participate, but what is special about these events is that all speakers are women. In our 3rd edition we will offer a whole day conference. name: Flutter meetup #3
description:
If you're interested in learning more about Flutter, this meetup is for you. This is the agenda for the event:

18:30 - Let's chat about Flutter
19:00 - Lightning talk: Scoped Model
19:15 - Let's discuss the how you implemented the challenge
20:15 - Networking with Pizza & Drinks sponsored by Novoda

The proposed challenge for June's meetup is to implement the following UI + Animations: https://www.uplabs.com/posts/travel-19268935-2bad-46a5-802d-d912e7299cef . Don't worry at all if you can't finish it, or if you can't start it, it's not a problem! During the event we'll discuss the different implementations that people come up with, what worked and what didn't.

Starting this month we're introducing lightning talks! In this case, Mishel will present about the Scoped Model Flutter app architecture, which is also used in the Fuchsia OS. If you want to present a lightning talk in a future event, it's really simple: pick a topic related to Flutter and prepare a 10~15 minute presentation. During the event you can propose your lightning talk for a future meetup, or you can also do it in the GDG Barcelona Slack group.

Additionally, starting this month we're also adding an optional-to-attend, informal chat about Flutter that will happen right before the main event. This is for everyone who wants to discuss anything in the Flutter space that we can't normally cover during the event itself. In this case, Rub√©n will bring his Pixelbook with Android Studio set up and a Flutter project that can be ran in the Pixelbook itself, so that people can play around with it.

Last but not least, we'll have some drinks and pizzas to end the event,
thanks to our cool sponsor Novoda! (http://novoda.com , https://twitter.com/novoda).

If you have any questions, please send them to the #flutter channel in the GDG Barcelona Slack (you can join it from https://gdgbcn.herokuapp.com).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Si est√°s interesado en saber m√°s y aprender sobre Flutter, este es tu meetup. En esta ocasi√≥n, tendremos la siguiente agenda:

18:30 - La previa
19:00 - Lightning talk: Scoped Model
19:15 - Discusi√≥n de las implementaciones del challenge
20:15 - Networking con Pizzas y bebidas, cortes√≠a de Novoda

Para esta sesi√≥n tenemos el siguiente dise√±o para implementar en Flutter: https://www.uplabs.com/posts/travel-19268935-2bad-46a5-802d-d912e7299cef . Si no lleg√°is a acabarlo, o no lo hac√©is, no pasa nada! En la sesi√≥n lo que haremos es discutir las diferentes implementaciones que se hayan hechos, y que ha funcionado mejor.

A partir de este evento introducimos lightning talks! En esta ocasi√≥n, Mishel nos hablar√° de la arquitectura para aplicaciones Flutter que usan en Fuchsia: scoped model. Si quer√©is dar una lightning talk en pr√≥ximas sesiones, es muy sencillo: escoged un tema breve relacionado con Flutter, y preparaos una charla de 10~15 minutos. Pod√©is proponer vuestras charlas para la pr√≥ximas sesiones durante el evento, o en el Slack de GDG Barcelona.

Y tambi√©n a partir de esta sesi√≥n tendremos la Previa, una parte opcional antes del evento principal. La idea es poder charlar un poco acerca de aquellas cosas del universo Flutter que siempre nos quedan fuera del tintero. En esta ocasi√≥n, Rub√©n nos traer√° un Pixelbook configurado con Android Studio, y un proyecto de Flutter que se lanza sobre la propia m√°quina, para que podamos cacharrear con √©l un poco.

Por √∫ltimo, pero no por ello menos importante, tendremos bebida y pizza para acabar el evento, gracias a nuestro patrocinador Novoda! (http://novoda.com , https://twitter.com/novoda).

Para cualquier duda, recordad que tenemos el canal #flutter en el Slack del GDG Barcelona (pod√©is apuntaros en https://gdgbcn.herokuapp.com).

Nos vemos el 14 de Junio en el MOB!

name: Spreadsheet Tools: Beyond Prototyping
description:
Hello family! We're back!

And this time we're going to learn about how Spreadsheet Tools can help us in our daily work.

Guillem Orpinell, Henrique Sousa, Philippe Oger and Xavi Pinyol will share with us their expierence with this tools. As they say:

"After two years working with Spreadsheet Tools, we can ensure they came to stay. Using Google Sheets and Google Apps Script (JS) we found the panacea: happy workers, high impact on productivity and low development cost. We would like to share some solutions and interesting cases as:
- Spreadsheet we have customized for specific Game Designing Features.
- The new Sheetfu library, an open source ORM to manipulate spreadsheets as database tables.
- How we managed to integrate spreadsheets with our JIRA processes.

The new paradigm allowed us to create functional prototypes in less than a week and iterate faster than ever. Presentation will be a summary of our experience and progress where we hope to find new enthusiasts to join on board."

Guillem Orpinell works as Tools Developer at Social Point. He founded and ran a startup on digital empowerment for 4 years.

Henrique Sousa works as Game Designer at Social Point. He has been working as a Game Designer and, occasionally, as a Game Developer since 2013.

Philippe Oger works as Tools developer at Social Point. 10 years of marketing user acquisition previously in various companies, including his own startups.

Xavi Pinyol works as Project Manager at Social Point. Previously, Mobile Lead Developer on Monster Legends and Dragon City.

We'll open doors at 6:45pm to start the talk at 7pm. And we'll have some beers and something to eat during the Networking time :).

Please join us at Social Point Headquarters on the 4.1 floor.

Looking forward to see you all!

Note: this event will be held in English.

name: Learn how to develop for Google Assistant with Actions on Google!
description:
Hello everyone !!

We bring you this time an amazing workshop of Actions for Google Assistant. Come and join us to build an action for the Assistant with GDE Francesco Pontillo.

The workshop will be about creating a Google Assistant Action using Actions on Google and DialogFlow. Our bot will be interacting with the API of Twitter and we will cover authentication flow besides of the creation of the bot and the fulfilment via webhook.
The event will be 4 hours long, in the offices of Novoda in the Mob & Pau. The door will be open at 9, so try be on time !
Please bring your laptop with everything needed for the workshop.

The codelab is at this link: https://github.com/frapontillo/actions-on-google-twitter-raffle.

The talk will be conducted in English.

Lets Build Actions for Your Community!!

About the speaker:
Francesco Pontillo is a software engineer who works for Novoda in their London offices. He is an expert developer in Assistant and Android.
https://developers.google.com/experts/people/francesco-pontillo

#ActionsOnGoogle #DialogFlow #GoogleAssistant #GDG #Event

name: Clean Architecture the right way! Or almost‚Ä¶
description:

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Description: In this talk we will analyze some implementations of Clean Architecture that are common in the Android community, and we‚Äôll see how they fit into the original proposal from Robert C. Martin. We will focus on those parts that usually don‚Äôt follow the theory, discussing on what we could improve if we had followed the original proposal. Finally, we will observe how we can bend these rules (especially with the help of Kotlin) to improve our code base and reduce boilerplate, while maintaining the same level of readability, maintainability, and scalability. Everything based on the real experience of building an app used by millions.

About the speaker: Rub√©n is a vocational developer, currently working as a Senior Android Engineer at Wallapop, and he is also one of the organizers of the GDG Barcelona. He formerly worked as Lead Android Developer at Redbooth, and as an assistant professor at the Autonomous University of Barcelona. When he is not coding for food, he is learning what being a father really means.

venue.address_1: Pla√ßa Pau Vila, 1, Edifici Palau de Mar, Oficina 3C, Moll del Dip√≤sit, Barcelona

description:
[English below]

Reserva tu plaza para este meetup en el siguiente enlace: http://meetu.ps/c/2JC9R/7kqjg/d

Hola Techmakers!

Tenemos nuevo evento! Y en esta ocasi√≥n Isabel Garrido Cardenas, senior backend developer PHP en Letgo nos va hablar sobre tipos de elementos que podemos usar para nuestros tests.

Cuando hablamos de tests generalmente pensamos en mocks, pero los mocks solo son un tipo de Test Double.
Lo que nos ense√±ar√° Isabel en esta charla ser√° ver qu√© son los Test Doubles y qu√© tipos existen, para que podamos usar el que mejor se adapte a cada situaci√≥n, utilizaremos como ejemplo el guardado y la b√∫squeda de un usuario en backend con php.
Adem√°s tambi√©n nos comentar√° una forma de usarlos para ayudar a hacer tests de c√≥digo que no los tenga y est√© muy acoplado.

Isabel es desarrolladora web desde hace 5 a√±os. Le gusta compaginar su vida laboral con la colaboraci√≥n con algunos proyectos relacionados con el bienestar animal (protectoras y educaci√≥n canina principalmente).
Comprometida con la diversidad de g√©nero en el mundo tecnol√≥gico, es mentora de una de las alumnas de Adalab del curso pasado y componente del comit√© de diversidad en la empresa en la que trabaja actualmente.
Comenz√≥ su carrera profesional en BQ y despu√©s de eso ha trabajado en diferentes empresas llevando a cabo tareas tanto de backend como de frontend.

Y despu√©s de la charla tendremos un ratito de Networking. Te esperamos!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please reserve your slot here: http://meetu.ps/c/2JC9R/7kqjg/d

Hello Techmakers!

Here we go with a new event! This time Isabel Garrido Cardenas, that‚Äôs working as senior backend developer at letgo is going to share with us her concerns about the elements we can use for testing.

When we talk about tests we generally use to think about mocks, but they are only a type of Test Double.
What Isabel is going to show us with this talk is what the Test Doubles are and how many types exist, in order to use the more specific in any case we find. As an example we're going to use the storing and search of a user in php language. Also she is going to explain a useful way to do code tests without this elements.

Isabel is web developer for 5 years. She likes also to collaborate in some initiatives that take care of animals well-being.
Engaged with gender diversity in the technologic sector, she is mentor of an Adalab student and she is part of the diversity commitee where she works right now.
She started her career working in BQ and after she kept working in other companies doing frontend and backend tasks.

And after the talk there will be time for networking. We wait for you!

name: Modularization: A real approach
description:
En el universo de Android afrontar retos es el pan de cada d√≠a, quien no se ha pasado minutos (por no decir horas) mirando la pantalla de Android Studio mientras compila nuestra aplicaci√≥n, quien no ha sufrido el Instant Run o ha tenido que hacer clean y rebuild m√∫ltiples veces hasta llegar al temido "invalidate Caches / Restart" al final de todo momento de desesperaci√≥n.

Malas noticias, siento deciros que todo esto nos seguir√° pasando, pero al menos en esta charla os contaremos la aproximaci√≥n que hemos tomado nosotros para solucionar algunos de los problemas que se nos presentaron al comenzar nuestra aplicaci√≥n desde cero y como a trav√©s de la modularizaci√≥n y de la elecci√≥n de ciertos componentes, como corutinas y un esquema de arquitectura algo diferente ha hecho que nuestro equipo haya ganado much√≠sima velocidad en desarrollo.

Os esperamos a todos, para pasar un buen rato y compartir nuestra experiencia, nuestra orientaci√≥n ser√° bastante pragm√°tica.

PD: Al final de la sesi√≥n habr√° pica pica.

Ponentes:

Txus Ballesteros (https://twitter.com/txusballesteros)

Lleva desarrollando en Android desde hace ni se sabe, ha pasado por empresas como MyTaxi o Wallapop, actualmente trabaja para Metropolis Lab donde dedica el tiempo a partes iguales desarrollando aplicaciones e investigando constantemente formas de simplificar y mejorar el desarrollo.

David Serrano (https://twitter.com/serr_david)

Lleva desarrollando en Android desde los comienzos de la plataforma, ha pasado por empresas como Letgo o Meetpays, actualmente trabaja en Metropolis Lab desarrollando aplicaciones y producto coordinando el conjunto para ofrecer la mayor calidad posible.

description:

Hola Techmakers!

Desde Women Techmakers Barcelona en colaboraci√≥n con AllWomen.tech nos gustar√≠a invitaros a un evento en el que vamos a tratar el tema de la diversidad en el mundo tech desde 3 puntos de vista: experiencias personales, comunidades y empresas.

¬øQu√© entendemos por diversidad?

Hablar de diversidad significa incluir y abrazar la variedad. Variedad como tantas realidades hay en nuestra sociedad. Una riqueza colectiva de la que formamos parte y podemos elevar juntxs. Para este encuentro nos centraremos en el colectivo femenino (en toda su amplitud), siendo conscientes de la existencia de otros igual de importantes.

¬øC√≥mo vamos a enfocar el evento?

Daremos espacio a que mujeres en tech nos cuenten sus experiencias personales a la hora de superar barreras para poder llegar a realizar una carrera en tecnolog√≠a.
Presentaremos algunas comunidades que trabajan para ayudar a las mujeres en tech proporcionando recursos y espacios para compartir experiencias e inquietudes.
Tambi√©n algunas empresas nos acompa√±ar√°n para explicarnos las acciones que est√°n tomando en pro a la diversidad.
Adem√°s contaremos con la presencia de Andr√©s L. Mart√≠nez Ortiz, director de Relaciones con Desarrolladores en Google. Nos presentar√° c√≥mo Google enfoca la diversidad con iniciativas como la de Women Techmakers.

El evento ser√° el pr√≥ximo lunes 17 de Diciembre, de 19h a 21h en la Facultad Inform√°tica de Barcelona (Edificio A3 - Aula Master, https://goo.gl/maps/ZHYFrDFfr812).

Queremos mostrar que la diversidad es cosa de todxs y que todxs podemos ayudar a que el desequilibro de mujeres en tecnolog√≠a sea menor.

Ven y acomp√°√±anos a conocer las iniciativas implicadas, as√≠ como experiencias reales. Te esperamos!

name: Flutter for the Androids!
description:
Flutter, Google's latest framework for creating mobile multiplatform projects, has reached stable version 1.0 only a few days ago. Moreover, there are projects to compile Flutter apps for Windows, Linux, MacOS, Raspberry Pi, and even for the Web! It's not anymore just Android and iOS. During this session, we will focus on why Android developers should care about Flutter and how it could enhance their projects, either new projects or existing ones.

For this session we will have 4 lightning talks that will cover the following areas:

- Layout basics: Joan Fuentes will talk about how you create UIs with Flutter, when you come from the Android world. What's the equivalent to a RecyclerView? Are there support libraries? Why there's no MATCH_PARENT?

- Inside Flutter: Mishel Vera will explain the inner workings of Flutter, and why it's so radically different from the Android SDK when it comes to rendering the UI. You'll learn why you don't need to care about recycling cells in a ListView.

- Beyond Android: Xavier Rigau will delight us with the world of possibilities that Flutter opens to us, that were impossible before (or just "too much work for the very few time we have to develop that feature"). Don't fear designers crazy ideas anymore!

- Together with Android: Ok, but we still have a base code in Kotlin/Java with bazillions of Android SDK lines of code. How amazing would it be if we could add Flutter on top of all that work? That's exactly what Rub√©n Serrano will tell us in this last talk.

At the end of the talk, for those that want to go further with Flutter, we'll show where you can find learning materials including a workshop we will run on January at the GDG. And we will reveal a special surprise event at the end.

You can't miss the last Flutter event of this year!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

name: Flutter Workshop: Yo! app clone with Flutter and Firebase
description:
Happy new Flutter year!

This time we have a workshop for those wanting to learn Flutter. In this session we will build a clone of the Yo! app (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.justyo) using Firebase as our backend. Just in 3 hours.

name: Flutter special meetup: Codemagic and Flutter Channels
description:
Codemagic: "CI as smooth as Flutter and a surprise for the community" Let‚Äôs talk about out of the box CI solutions. Codemagic is a free dedicated CI/CD service for Flutter. It was announced during Flutter live in December 2018 and is now presenting at the MWC 2019 together with Flutter. Martin Jeret will demonstrate how to set-up your pipeline and Andri Jasinski will share some major news about recent development efforts.

"Communication between Flutter and Native Modules" by Rohan Taneja

Even though Flutter is great, everyone does not have the privilege of building a Flutter app from scratch for their use-case. Hence, this talk would cover basic two-way communication between the native (OEM) apps and a Flutter module for already existing native (OEM) apps.

name: Booting Fuchsia, burying Android
description:
How many mobile devices can update their OS to the newest version after 4 years (or 2 if it's an Android)? How many apps do you install and then completely forget about them? And in case you are a mobile developer, how it feels supporting different OS versions that can behave completely different? How many times have you wished to use any language as a first class citizen for mobile development?

In this talk we will show how FuchsiaOS addresses the former problems with its modular design and its new kernel created from scratch (no Linux here); its use of AI; and its platform UI development SDK, based on Flutter, which also lets you to reuse the app for Android and iOS (and other desktop OS and the web in a near future). But it doesn't stop here, and Fuchsia will be the OS for any kind of device, from IoT devices to the Cloud.

The SDK for Fuchsia is out there. Are you ready to learn the future of multi-purpose operating systems?
